channel.title: Create and track feature requests for Atlassian products.
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70981] Inconsistent image attachment behaviour between instances and OS' relating to attachment pop-up and copy/pasting images.
item.description:
Summary

Pasting an image into comments produces different results across instances and OS, sometimes a pop-up will appear which deletes any comment that is the progress of being typed, other times no pop-up appears and the markup 

!image_name.png|thumbnail!

is inserted directly into the comments and the image uploaded.

Also when the pop-up does appear it removes any comments that are in the process of being written, usually where the image is intended to be inserted.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create an issue
  2. Write a comment and copy & paste an image into the comment while writing.

Expected Results

Consistent behaviour that attaches the image and doesn't remove the comment. If pop-up appears the image should be attached and the markup placed in the comment to include the thumbnail.

Actual Results

Behaviour I have observer (all tested using Chrome 70):

On my instance the following:
OSX + Mouse = Pop-up
OSX + Keyboard = Pop-up
Win10 + Mouse = No pop-up
Win10 + Keyboard = No pop-up

*Customers instance: *
OSX + Mouse = Pop-up
OSX + Keyboard = Pop-up
Win10 + Mouse = Pop-up
Win10 + Keyboard = Pop-up

Whenever the pop-up does appear it removes the comment that was in the process of being written and was the intended destination for the image attachment.

Notes

Instance details in internal comment to protect privacy.
I have also attache HAR files of both observed results.

Workaround

Paste the image directly into the issue without selecting inside a comment field as this will create a pop-up where the image can be uploaded and a comment added at the same time.
item.summary: Inconsistent image attachment behaviour between instances and OS' relating to attachment pop-up and copy/pasting images.

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70980] Adding users to group failed due to case sensitivity
item.description:
Summary

The operation to add users to groups is a case-sensitive operation. The operation will fail with error User <Abc> does not exist if the user key in the URL doesn't match the casing.

This may happen to admins who created the user via REST API and accessing the user's account by directly building the URL for memberships configuration.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Go to any user from user management.
  2. In the URL, change the user key at the end of the URL e.g. from .../view?username=abc to .../view?username=Abc.
  3. Viewing the user's account is still working without any issue.
  4. Try to add the user to a group.

Expected Result

User is added into the group considering that there's no error in viewing the user's account.

Current Result

User <Abc> does not exist is thrown.

Workaround

Access the user's account via Atlassian Cloud user management to have the exact casing of the user key in the URL.
item.summary: Adding users to group failed due to case sensitivity

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70979] Browser extensions (Mobex) cause Jira login to fail
item.description:
Summary

Browser extensions like Mobex causes Jira login to fail.

How to reproduce

  1. In chrome add the extension Mobex
  2. Log out of Atlassian
  3. Try to log back into id.atlassian.com

Expected behavior

Login successful

Actual results

Login unsuccessful
Error message: OOps... you've performed a malformed request.

Workaround

Clear browser cache and disable extensions until you find the cause
item.summary: Browser extensions (Mobex) cause Jira login to fail

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70977] Jira doesn't always send email for filter subscription
item.description:
Summary

Jira doesn't always send email for filter subscription.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a filter with any JQL (see below for example)
    • project = ABC AND created >= -1h
  2. Create a filter subscription to make Jira send email every 15 min (or 1 hour). Make sure Email this filter, even if there are no issues found is ticked.

Actual Result

Jira doesn't always send email every 15 min.

Expected Result

Jira keep sending the email every 15 min regardless if it returns result or not.
item.summary: Jira doesn't always send email for filter subscription

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70973] Comment will disappear in the new issue detail view if you press ctrl + z after adding the code tag
item.description:
Summary

If you type a comment in the new issue detail view, highlight a part of the text, click on the code block icon (<>), then press ctrl + z right after, the comment will disappear.

If you close the window and get back to the same issue, the comment appears again.

See the recording: Issue detail view comment.mp4

Environment

Jira Cloud.

Steps to Reproduce

1) Go to a Kanban Board (or business)
2) Click on an issue
3) Click to add a comment to that issue
4) Type some text
5) Highlight something in the middle of what has been typed so far
6) Click the "<>" button
7) Press CTRL+Z

Expected Results

It should only remake the previous change in the comment.

Actual Results

The whole comment will disappear.

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Comment will disappear in the new issue detail view if you press ctrl + z after adding the code tag

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70972] Unable to preview mp4 attachment in Firefox and Chrome
item.description:
Summary

Unable to play mp4 in Chrome and Firefox

Steps to Reproduce

  1. While using Chrome/Firefox, add mp4 file in any Jira issue
  2. Once mp4 file added, try to preview it

Expected Results

MP4 video will be preview

Actual Results

  • Unable to preview the file
  • Browser console show the following error 
    VIDEOJS: ERROR: (CODE:4 MEDIA_ERR_SRC_NOT_SUPPORTED) The video could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported. 

Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Failed to load because no supported source was found.

Workaround

  • Use Edge or Safari
  • Alternatively, you can also download the file and play it using an app form your machine
item.summary: Unable to preview mp4 attachment in Firefox and Chrome

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70970] Agile rest api for epic is not working for Next-gen projects.
item.description:
Summary

Agile rest api for epic is not working for Next-gen projects.

Steps to Reproduce

  • Create a next gen scrum project
  • Create an epic in the board
  • Call the agile board rest api for epics
GET https://site.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/board/<BOARD_ID>/epic

{"maxResults":50,"startAt":0,"isLast":true,"values":[{"id":11472,"key":"SCRUM-19","self":"https://site.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/epic/11472","name":"","summary":"epic","color":{"key":"color_1"},"done":false}]}
  • Call the self URL of the epic
GET https://site.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/epic/11472

Expected Results

The epic details should be returned

Actual Results

The call fails with a 404 and permission error message. 

Request URL: https://try-ramon-appswitcher.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/epic/11472
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 404 

{"errorMessages":["The requested epic cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."],"errors":{}}
item.summary: Agile rest api for epic is not working for Next-gen projects.

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70969] [New Issue View] Unable to save Description or Comment when '! !' present in the code macro
item.description:
Summary:
Unable to save a description or comment when a code macro exists and contains two exclamations marks separated by 1 or more characters:

Screenshot:

Code snippet 1:

!     testing    !

Code snippet 2:

if (a !== 1 && b !== c) {
d
}

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create or go to an existing issue
  2. Insert code macro
  3. Insert two exclamation mark with at least one space in between on the same line
  4. Save

Expected behaviour
Comment or Description will save

Current behaviour
Comment or Description will not save

Workaround:
Use a maximum of one exclamation mark per line.
item.summary: [New Issue View] Unable to save Description or Comment when '! !' present in the code macro

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70967] Inconsistence in JQL searches towards resolution
item.description:
Summary

There is inconsistence in the results when performing JQL searches based on the Resolution.

Tests

  • Example #1: issue AP-10 - Unresolved; issue AP-1 - Unresolved (but had a resolution set at some point):
    • Search #1: resolution is EMPTY AND project = AP -> No issue returned
    • Search #2: resolution = unresolved AND project = AP -> No issue returned
    • Search #3: resolution WAS unresolved AND project = AP -> No issue returned
    • resolution #4: resolution WAS EMPTY AND project = AP -> Issue AP-1 returned

There may be different results in different Jira instances. I was not able to match results between my test instance and a teammate's one, for example.

Environment

Jira Cloud

Expected Results

Search #1: should return AP-10.
Search #2: should return AP-10.
Search #3: if Search #4 returned AP-1, this one should have returned AP-1 as well.

Actual Results

  • Search #1: No issue returned
  • Search #2: No issue returned
  • Search #3: No issue returned

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Inconsistence in JQL searches towards resolution

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70965] "Recent" Conflence spaces under the "App Switcher" still showing after deletion
item.description:
Summary

On the App Switcher in Jira, recently accessed Confluence spaces are showing under "Recent" section.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Update a Confluence space
  2. Either delete the space or deactivate Confluence entirely
  3. Go to Jira
  4. Open the App switcher

Expected Results

  1. The Confluence spaces should be removed from the App Switcher

Actual Results

  1. The Confluence spaces still appear in the App Switcher despite Confleunce being deactivated or the Spaces deleted

Notes

Workaround

Non
item.summary: "Recent" Conflence spaces under the "App Switcher" still showing after deletion

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70962] Jira backup import fails due to PSQLException
item.description:
Summary

When performing a Cloud to Cloud Jira import, the import fails due to PSQLException.

Environment

  • Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Generate Jira Backup
  2. Attempt to import to Cloud instance

Expected Results

Jira data is imported successfully

Actual Results

This error message is seen through the UI:

Problems with the JIRA Import Wizard
The import wizard is reporting the following problems:

Error importing data: PSQLException

Logs show the following:

Error occurred while importing data.

com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:IssueTypeFieldAssociation][issueTypeId,10301][fieldIdentifier,summary][created,2018-07-13 09:52:31.178329][id,1][position,0][category,not_configurable][updated,2018-07-13 09:52:31.178329][required,true] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issue_type_field_association (ID, issuetype_id, field_identifier, field_position, field_category, REQUIRED, default_value, CREATED, UPDATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: column "default_value" is of type jsonb but expression is of type character varying Hint: You will need to rewrite or cast the expression. Position: 193))

Notes

This might seem related to JRACLOUD-68436, as they are both showing the same error through the UI. However, the detailed logs show a different cause, and this one affects Cloud to Cloud imports.

Workaround

No workarounds at the moment.
item.summary: Jira backup import fails due to PSQLException

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

item.component: Backup & Restore - Import From JIRA Cloud

comments.comment: Shouldn't this issue be highest priority, same as JRACLOUD-68436?
It should be Highest priority - it's very serious degradation...

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70959] Attachments of renamed projects get exported with the old project key in backup
item.description:
Summary

Attachments of renamed projects get exported with the old project key in backup

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create an issue in an existing project, e.g project key=ES
  2. Add an attachment to an issue
  3. Rename the project key, e.g set new project key to AA
  4. Generate an export file
  5. In the attachments folder, there will be no folder with the AA key. There will be a folder with the ES key
  6. Import the export file to a target instance
  7. The project will be created with the new key AA and the attachments will be linked to the correct issues

Expected Results

To have attachments folder exported with the updated project key

Actual Results

Attachments folder is created with the old project key

Notes

Jira won't allow any new projects to be created or renamed to a project key which was already in use, i.e ES.
item.summary: Attachments of renamed projects get exported with the old project key in backup

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70954] Wiki style renderer does not display indention according to preview
item.description:
Summary

Wiki style renderer does not display indention according to preview

Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a comment in Jira with the following texts

* Line 1
** Line 2
*** Line 3

2. Preview the text

3. Add the comment

Expected Results

The added comment should be exactly as the preview.

Actual Results

The added comment comment shows a different rendering on the indention.
item.summary: Wiki style renderer does not display indention according to preview

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70943] Code macro for xml does not properly syntax highlight comments
item.description:
Summary

The code macro for xml does not properly highlight commented out lines if the comment contains an xml tag. The syntax highlighting is looking for > instead of --> to end the comment highlight.

Environment

Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a comment or issue body with the bellow macro content: 
    {code:xml}
<xml1>some stuff</xml1>
<!--comment with no tags-->
<!--<xml1>comment with tags</xml1>
{code}

Expected Results

The commented line highlighting should extend all the way up to and including the -->

Actual Results

The comment highlighting ends incorrectly with the first > in the line

Notes

What ever logic being used for comment highlighting seems to be looking only for > to signal the end of the commented line instead of -->

Workaround

None
item.summary: Code macro for xml does not properly syntax highlight comments

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70933] Fabric Code Format error when copy and paste a text inside it
item.description:
Summary

When pasting a text inside some "Code Formats" using Fabric, the text is pasted outside of the Format editor.
Video example: Recording #18.mp4

Environment

Jira Cloud.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to an issue and try to add a comment
  2. Select the . . . menu and choose some of those formats
  3. Paste a text inside the Format editor

Expected Results

The text should be added inside the Format editor

Actual Results

The format is missed

Workaround

No workaround
item.summary: Fabric Code Format error when copy and paste a text inside it

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

comments.comment: Ran into this bug when trying to replicate how I use "Preformatted" option that used to be under the "+" dropdown in the previous text editor. Don't see how I can paste blocks of text into sections (grey boxes) until this is fixes or workaround provided.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70930] When changing the language to Czech, date shows Roman numerals instead of the month name
item.description:
Summary

When changing the language to Czech, date shows Roman numerals instead of the month name.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Change the profile language/system language to Czech.
  2. Add some date on a ticket, it could be any date field.

Expected Results

It shows 24/Řij/18.

Actual Results

It shows 24/X/18.
item.summary: When changing the language to Czech, date shows Roman numerals instead of the month name

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70928] Incorrect error message displayed when unable to link issues due to lack of permissions
item.description:
Summary

The error "Wait for a few moments, then give it another try" is displayed when linking an issue from a Next-gen project to an issue in a classic project. This happens when the user does not have the "Link issue" permission for the classic project.

Environment

Jira cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Remove the "Link issue" permission for the user in the classic project.
  2. Try linking the issue from next-gen project to the classic project issue.

Expected Results

An appropriate error message is displayed hinting to the lack of required permissions to perform the task.

Actual Results

"Wait for a few moments, then give it another try" error is displayed.
item.summary: Incorrect error message displayed when unable to link issues due to lack of permissions

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70927] Inconsistent behaviour of link issue permission between Next-gen and classic projects
item.description:
Summary

When linking an issue between a Next-gen and classic project the user requires the "Link Issues" permission for the classic project whereas when linking an issue between a classic project A and classic project B, the user does not require the "Link Issues" permission for the Project B.

Environment

Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Link issues between a next-gen project and classic project where the user does not have "Link Issues" permission for the classic project.
  2. Link issues between two classic projects where the user does not have "Link Issues" permission for the project.

Expected Results

The expected result is to have the same permission requirements irrespective of the type of project.

Actual Results

There is a difference in the required permissions.
item.summary: Inconsistent behaviour of link issue permission between Next-gen and classic projects

status.description: Atlassian needs to verify that this issue exists

item.component: Project Administration - Users and Roles and Permissions

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70925] HTTP 400 response code when DB connection error is encountered
item.description:
Summary

When an update issue rest call encounters a DB connection error for cloud, an HTTP 400 response code is returned instead of a server error response code or a 429 rate limit code.

Steps to Reproduce

Send a PUT https://<site>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/ call against a site that is currently overloaded.

Expected Results

  • A 500 server error or 429 rate limit error should be returned to the client.
  • Have a mechanism to handle this scenario instead of throwing 400 response back for the edit issue call.

Actual Results

An HTTP 400 (Bad request) response is sent to the client. 

400	PUT	/rest/api/2/issue/

Exception occurred editing issue: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Exception while inserting the following entity: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,xxxxxx][issue,xxxxx][xxxxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxxx] 
(Unable to establish a connection with the database. 
(PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection))
item.summary: HTTP 400 response code when DB connection error is encountered

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70921] Incorrect Russian Translation for Summary
item.description:
Summary

With the recent updates, Summary and Description field have the same word when the language is set to Russian. It confuses users as they have the same field name.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Go to Profile and change the language to Russian
  2. Create a new issue which will display Summary and Description

Actual Result

Both fields have the same word (Описание):

Expected Result

Summary should have different translation.
item.summary: Incorrect Russian Translation for Summary

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70919] Incorrect translation to French of the field Due Date
item.description:
Summary

The field Due Date is being translated incorrectly

Environment

Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Change the language of Jira to French
  2. Check the Due Date field

Expected Results

The field name should be translated to Date d'échéance with an apostrophe on the d'échéance

Actual Results

The field name is translated to Date déchéance without the apostrophe
item.summary: Incorrect translation to French of the field Due Date

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

comments.comment:
Hi,

Considering the fact that Atlassian supports French language, this issue should be resolved quickly and without efforts.

Due Date (Date d'échéance) is use in many boards and boards are often presented to high management. An incorect translation isn't acceptable. The meaning of "déchéance" without apostrophees is not a nice word in French.

I'm sure you do understand our concern and hope this simple issue will be quickly resolved.

Thanks,

Regards,

Richard

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70915] Submitting a comment without network connectivity causes the comment to disappear on Android Jira Mobile
item.description:
Summary

Submitting a comment without network connectivity causes the comment to disappear on Adroid Jira Mobile

Environment

Android Jira Mobile App

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Start entering a comment
  2. Enable airplane mode
  3. Try to submit the comment
  4. Notice the comment has disappeared

Expected Results

  • Comment remains in the comment box like on iOS and can be re-submitted once connectivity is restored

Actual Results

The comment disappears

Notes

Unique scenario of when someone is entering a large comment and hits send just as they lose network connectivity

Workaround

No known workaround
item.summary: Submitting a comment without network connectivity causes the comment to disappear on Android Jira Mobile

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70912] Invalid value 'YYYY' passed for customfield error when creating issue from backlog view on board
item.description:
Summary:

Invalid Value passed for customfield error when creating issue from backlog view on board

Steps to replicate:

  1. Create 2 or more Custom Fields where the same option is used.
  2. Click Create issue in Backlog view
  3. Type in summary (in the What needs to be done? field) and press Enter

Expected Result:

Issue is created and is added to the Backlog.

Actual Result:

The create screen is presented with error: Please fix fields marked below
And error under that XXXX custom field: Invalid Value 'YYYY' passed for customfield 'XXXX'.

Workaround:

Remove options that are also used in other Custom Fields
item.summary: Invalid value 'YYYY' passed for customfield error when creating issue from backlog view on board

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70910] Time Since Chart adds 'created DESC' even if it's already in the filter
item.description:
Summary

Uploaded image for project: 'JIRA Cloud (including JIRA Core)'

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a filter with the following JQL : project = PROJECT order by created desc
  2. Use a Time Since Chart gadget and configure it to use the created filter
  3. Click on any of the Time bars

Expected Results

The issue navigator will load with the resulting issues.

Actual Results

The issue navigator will load with an error because the "order by created" clause is duplicated

Workaround

Use a filter that does not contain the "order by created" clause
item.summary: Time Since Chart adds 'created DESC' even if it's already in the filter

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70909] HTTP Status 403 returned for DB connection error when calling REST APIs
item.description:
Summary

Bulk rest api calls that fails with DB connection errors is returning a 403 response code to the client.

1. Content response is even more misleading :

<html>
<head>
    <title>Forbidden (403)</title> 
<!--[if IE]><![endif]-->
<script type="text/javascript" >

2. Jira application logs indicates DB connection error from too many request within a short period of time. 

ERROR	com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper	
Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: 
Unable to establish a connection with the database. (PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS Exception already occurred in this workcontext, skipping next getConnection)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Call REST APIs in continuous succession

Expected Results

If the rate limit is hit, the status 429. Throttling limit state should be returned in headers like here

Actual Results

HTTP 403 response code returned with the following content 

<html>
<head>
    <title>Forbidden (403)</title>

<script type="text/javascript" >

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70901] Recently Created Chart gadget, sorting Daily, displays the results shifted one day
item.description:
Summary
Recently Created Chart gadget, sorting Daily, displays the results shifted one day back

Steps to Reproduce
Have a Recently Created Chart gadget with a daily period, create and resolve issues today.

Expected Results
The bar displaying today's stats should increase, reflecting tickets created and resolved today

Actual Results
The bar from the day before increases, erroneously displaying today's progress as yesterday's
item.summary: Recently Created Chart gadget, sorting Daily, displays the results shifted one day

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70896] When cloning an Issue, issue links can not be copied unless there is a linked Issue
item.description:
If the only link on an issue is a link to a Confluence page or some other external page there is no option to copy this link when cloning the issue.

To Reproduce

  1. Create an issue in JIRA.
  2. Link the issue to a Confluence page
  3. Clone the JIRA issue.

Result
In the Clone Issue dialog there is no checkbox to copy issue links.

Expected
The checkbox should be shown to copy issue links.

Workaround

  1. On the issue you want to clone, add a link to a different JIRA issue (just don't use 'clones' or 'is cloned by' types)
  2. Now when you clone there is a checkbox to copy links. Check the box. The Confluence/external link will be copied along with the JIRA issue link.
  3. After cloning, remove the unwanted JIRA issue link.
item.summary: When cloning an Issue, issue links can not be copied unless there is a linked Issue

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70895] User Management does not get synced with Jira
item.description:
Summary

User Management does not get synced with Jira causing any changes in user management e.g. new user created or group membership changes won't be reflected in Jira. The new user won't be able to log in. New site admin, however, can still reach user management administration page.
item.summary: User Management does not get synced with Jira

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70894] User with comma in its username won't receive mention notifications
item.description:
Summary

If a user has comma in it's username (e.g. user,name), mention notifications won't be sent to it.

PS. Other notifications are not affected.

Environment

Jira Cloud.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Have a user that has comma in its username;
  2. Mention that user in an issue.

Expected Results

The user will receive the notification when mentioned.

Actual Results

The mention notification won't be sent.

Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
item.summary: User with comma in its username won't receive mention notifications

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70893] User CSV export does not treat usernames with comma properly
item.description:
Summary

When exporting the user list to CSV, the importer won't handle it properly.

Example:

  • Have a user with username = user,name;
  • Export the users to CSV in the user management;
  • Since there is a comma in the username, it will impact in the CSV row for that user, since the comma is the default delimiter:
    • Notice that the username will be divided in two columns. And because of that, all the other information will be wrongly positioned, even putting information in an additional column:

Environment

Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Have a user with comma in it's username;
  2. Export the Users to CSV in the user management.

Expected Results

The username should not be divided. When there is a string with comma, it should be exported in quotes: "user,name".

Actual Results

The string is divided in two columns, impacting in the whole row for that user in the CSV

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: User CSV export does not treat usernames with comma properly

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70886] External System Import may choose invalid issue type when importing CSV
item.description:
Description

Whenever creating a project using the External System Import feature, Jira may automatically select an invalid issue type if the Issue Type Scheme contains multiple issue types with the same name.

How to reproduce

  1. Go to Jira Settings > System > External System import
  2. Select CSV
  3. Choose the Defined in CSV option to create a new project in the process
  4. Upload the file that contains both the project's and issues' definitions
  5. Map the fields accordingly
  6. Import the issue

Expected Behavior

  • In case the Issue Type Scheme contained multiple records of the same issue type (one from a Next-Gen project and the other a "regular" issue type, Jira should recognize the proper issue type to be used

Actual Behavior

  • Jira chooses the incorrect issue type to be used, causing the issue to use an invalid issue type
    • The Story issue type in the picture is from a Next-Gen project
item.summary: External System Import may choose invalid issue type when importing CSV

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70884] JQL word stemming checks issue history if the field it is querying against is empty
item.description:
Summary

Word stemming in JQL currently check against issue history if the field it is querying for is empty.

Step to Replicate

  1. Create a ticket with a custom text field in it. Populate the field with 'ToDo'.
  2. Edit the ticket and remove the text field value.
  3. Go to the issue navigator and run the query below. 
    field1 ~ "ToDo"
  4. The issue will be returned despite it being empty. The JQL is also checking the issue history.
  5. Go back to the issue and change the text field value to 'Test'.
  6. Run the JQL query again from the issue navigator again.
  7. This time the issue will not be returned.

Expected Result

Word stemming should not be querying against issue history when the field that is specified in the clause is empty.

Current Result

Word stemming is querying against issue history when the field that is specified in the clause is empty.
item.summary: JQL word stemming checks issue history if the field it is querying against is empty

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70881] WebHooks do not fire for 'Log Work' events if triggered as part of a transition.
item.description:
Summary

If a WebHook is created to fire on a Log Work event (created, updated, deleted) this fails to fire if the log work event happens as part of a transition.
If work is logged outside of a transition the WebHook fires as expected.

Environment

Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Get a WebHook URL from https://webhook.site
  2. Create a WebHook like:
  3. Create a screen with the 'Log Work' field and associate the screen to a transition:
  4. Trigger the transition and update the work log field:

Expected Results

The WebHook will fire and a response will be seen in the test WebHook site.

Actual Results

The WebHook is not fired and no data is posted to the test WebHook site.

Notes

Log work WebHook fires OK when done outside of transition.
I have tested the same thing with a comments WebHook and this did work as expected and was fired during transition

Workaround

Log work outside of the transition.
item.summary: WebHooks do not fire for 'Log Work' events if triggered as part of a transition.

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70878] Jira cloud to cloud backup/restore process reconfigures the DVCS account link in target instance
item.description:
Summary

Bitbucket commits link to new target instance(does not have DVCS connector configured yet) when performing a backup of source instance(which has the original DVCS connector) and importing to the target instance

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Do a site backup of a cloud instance which has a DVCS connector
  2. Edit the entities.xml file
  3. Do a restore in new target instance

Expected Results

Bitbucket connected would still link to original instance

Actual Results

BItbucket links to new instance

Application logs:

Notes

This is a very edge case

Workaround

N/A

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70875] Issue Comment Permalink Does Not Open Correctly on Mobile Web Browser
item.description:
Summary

  • The issue comment permalink is not displayed correctly from the mobile web browser
  • If you have the JIRA mobile application, it will display properly in the client

Environment

  • iOS v12.0.1
  • JIRA Mobile v65.0.0.579

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Copy the permalink from the desktop view of JIRA Cloud
  2. Paste the link on a mobile web browser (eg. Safari / Chrome)

Expected Results

The comment will be redirected will be displayed correctly in the web browser

Actual Results

The following error is displayed on the web browser

If you open the issue itself, you will notice that there is no feature to copy the permalink of the comment

Workaround

Remove the /comment/<comment_id> so the URL looks like this - https://<fqdn>/plugins/servlet/mobile#issue/<issue_id>
item.summary: Issue Comment Permalink Does Not Open Correctly on Mobile Web Browser

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment: This makes using the slack integration really difficult on mobile since every link has a comment id. A quick fix could be to remove comment ids from slack integration urls
I didn't realize slack integration was a separate company, I created a ticket in their system https://bitband.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/CS-76
We need to fix this. This is not a bug on slack. It is on our side.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70871] As an admin, I can't view the Sub Task Manager (add-on) project-specific templates in the sidebar with Navigation v2 enabled
item.description:
Summary

In the updated navigation left sidebar, if the Cloud instance has the [Sub Task Managerhttps://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214056/sub-task-manager-for-jira-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on, admins are unable to access the project-specific templates they had previously created.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Pre req 1: Be sure your instance is using the updated navigation left sidebar;
  2. Pre req 2: Be a Jira admin of that instance;
  3. Pre req 3: Have the "Sub Task Manager" add-on installed;
  4. Access a project.

Expected Results

  • The project-specific templates from "Sub Task Manager" should be accessible in the left sidebar by the admin clicking the "Add-ons" sub menu.

Actual Results

  • There is no "Add-ons" sub menu, so admins can't access the project-specific templates from "Sub Task Manager".

Workaround(s)

  1. If needed, create a globally available template;
  2. Open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
item.summary: As an admin, I can't view the Sub Task Manager (add-on) project-specific templates in the sidebar with Navigation v2 enabled

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment:
Sub Task Manager can display one of two pages in the Add-ons menu. One is for Jira Software and the other for non-Jira Software versions of Jira.  They are the same page but they just vary the language displayed.  The two conditions (one for each page) are:

 

"conditions":[{"condition": "can_use_application", "params": {"applicationKey": "jira-software"}, "invert": true}, 
              {"or": [{"condition":"has_project_permission", "params": {"permission": "ADMINISTER_PROJECTS"}}, 
                      {"condition": "addon_property_contains_any_user_group", 
                        "params": {"entity": "addon", "propertyKey": "com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config", "objectName": "accessToTemplates"}}] 
                     }] 
"conditions":[{"condition": "can_use_application", "params": {"applicationKey": "jira-software"}, "invert": false}, 
              {"or": [{"condition":"has_project_permission", "params": {"permission": "ADMINISTER_PROJECTS"}}, 
                      {"condition": "addon_property_contains_any_user_group", 
                        "params": {"entity": "addon", "propertyKey": "com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config", "objectName": "accessToTemplates"}}] 
}]

The jira-software user part shouldn't cause problems because there is a check in one and an inverted check in the other.  Hani has checked his user and he has Project Administer permission:

 

He has also added the administrators group (which he belongs to) for the accessToTemplates application property check that his user belongs to.  I got him to run:

 
AP.request({url: '/rest/atlassian-connect/1/addons/com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.jira/properties/com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config',contentType: "application/json",success: function(response)

{console.log("Config=",response);}

,error: function(response) {console.log("Error=",response);}});
and it returned:

 

VM91:3 Config= {"key":"com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config","value": {"accessToGlobalTemplates":["administrators"],"accessToTemplates":["administrators"]}

 

So the jira-software or inverted jira-software check should get him in and his user meets both parts of the or condition.  I now have another user who seems to have the same problem, although I haven't yet done the permissions helper and application property checks.

 

I going to try combining both pages into one and remove the jira-software check to see if this will make any difference

 

Thanks

Paul

Actually just realised that the jira-software tests are also in the global template page, which Hani does have access to.  The global page conditions for jira-software and non jira-software are:

 

 

"conditions":  [{"condition": "user_is_logged_in"},
                {"condition": "can_use_application", "params": {"applicationKey": "jira-software"}, "invert": true}, 
                {"or": [{"condition":"user_is_admin"},
                        {"condition": "addon_property_contains_any_user_group",
                           "params": {"entity": "addon", "propertyKey": "com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config", "objectName": "accessToGlobalTemplates"}}
                       ]
                }]
 
"conditions":  [{"condition": "user_is_logged_in"},
                {"condition": "can_use_application", "params": {"applicationKey": "jira-software"}, "invert": false}, 
                {"or": [{"condition":"user_is_admin"},
                        {"condition": "addon_property_contains_any_user_group",
                           "params": {"entity": "addon", "propertyKey": "com.redmoon.subtaskmanager.config", "objectName": "accessToGlobalTemplates"}}
                       ]
                }]

 

I'll still remove the jira-software checks but I'll add in user_is_admin check to the OR for the project screen

By Removing jira-software and adding user_is_admin it seemed to fix the problem.  Since Hani is a adminstrator and the Permission Helper says he has project administer privileges this looks like a bug in Jira not being to correctly identify him as a project admin or understand the conditions

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70865] Copying link in description or comment fields fails in new Jira issue view
item.description:
Summary

If you copy a link that ends with a slash and paste it in the description or comment field, it fails with following error:

We couldn't save your comment
It might be empty, too long, or have invalid
formatting. If you copy-pasted, try removing the
formatting and adding it directly in the editor.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Type following link as comment and save it:

    https://test.com/

  2. Copy the link from the comment
  3. Past the link into another comment (or in description field) and click Save

Expected Results

Comment/description saves

Actual Results

Following error appears in UI and browser's console:

Workaround

Click on the link and select Unlink before saving it, see screenshot below:
item.summary: Copying link in description or comment fields fails in new Jira issue view

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70864] Pasting colon from any source into comments field causes comment to fail to be added - new issue view
item.description:
Summary

When pasting text from any source into the comment field on the new issue view that contains a colon, the comment fails to be added. This even includes copy pasting from within the same issue.

Environment

Cloud - New Issue View

Steps to Reproduce

Within Jira:

  1. Create a comment within an Issue on Jira (using new issue view).
  2. Copy this comment including the colon.
  3. Paste the comment.

External source for text:

  1. Copy text including a comment from gmail or word for example.
  2. Paste this into comment in Jira new issue view

Expected Results

Comment should appear as expected including the colon

Actual Results

No exception found at this time in logs, will update if I find one.

Workaround

  1. Disable the new issue view
  2. Manually type the colon (intermittent success, worked for me but not for customer)
item.summary: Pasting colon from any source into comments field causes comment to fail to be added - new issue view

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70863] Rest API with Exclamation in description gets escaped
item.description:
Summary

When creating issues through REST API, if the description field contains an exclamation character the character gets escaped on Jira. This causes the editor to fail to renderr properly

How to reproduce

  1. Make a rest api call for create issue with the body below. 
    
POST Command: https://site.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/

{
	"fields": 
	{
		"project": 
		{
			"id": "10001"
		},
		"issuetype": 
		{
			"id": "10001"
		},
		"summary": "Testisng",
		"description": 
		{
			"type": "doc",
			"version": 1,
			"content": [
			{
				"type": "paragraph",
				"content": [
				{
					"type": "text",
					"text": "Testing"
				}
				]
			},
			{
				"type": "paragraph",
				"content": [
				{
					"type": "text",
					"text": "!Testing!"
				}
				]
			}
			]
		}
	}
}

Expected behavior

An issue should be created with the description below

!Testing!

Actual results

Issue is created with the description showing the exclamation character escaped

\!Testing\!

Workaround

Currently none
item.summary: Rest API with Exclamation in description gets escaped

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70838] Resolution set during issue creation is removed, leaving resolved date populated

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70816] Adding a special character at the end of the Issue URL will still show the issue but will cause problems
item.description:
Summary

When adding a special character to an issue, it will still display the issue but won't allow any comments to be added and the transition issue looks like it fails but it actually does transition the issue.

Environment

  • Jira Cloud
  • Jira Server needs to be confirmed

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to any Jira Issue but add a special character on the end like a full stop - https://testinstance.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-1.
  2. Comment on the issue

Expected Results

  1. Either the comment should be added to the issue
  2. Or the issue shouldn't display when the URL contains special characters on the end

     

    Actual Results

An error is shown when trying to comment as shown in the screenshot below:

 

Communications Breakdown

The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.

Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser

 

Why is this important?

I doubt that users will be adding characters like dollar signs after the issue URL, however; it's reasonable to believe that there are issue URL's being shared that contain a full stop at the end which is then added to the URL.

If the user is using Jira and types an issue with a full stop followed by pressing the space button (https://test.atlassian.net/test-1. ), Jira will include the full stop in the hyperlink. Now when a user clicks the link with the full stop and comments on an issue, they will encounter this bug.

This is how I discovered this bug by being sent a link with a full stop.

Workaround

Remove special characters from the end of the issue URL
item.summary: Adding a special character at the end of the Issue URL will still show the issue but will cause problems

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70811] Duplicated Workflows in the backup file causes import to fail
item.description:
Summary

When importing to the Cloud, the import fails on the validation stage with this error:

Import error

There was an error importing file jira-export (4).zip: Validation failed. Following issues were reported:
Cannot complete the import because one of the import files contains the following duplicate workflows: 'workflow 1'. Search the Atlassian Administrator Knowledge Base for instructions on how to fix this, or contact Atlassian Support for help.

This happens when there are Workflows with the same name in the Backup file. By right, workflows may not have the same name; Jira will not allow this through the UI. However, if the Workflow names has the same name but with different letter case, for example:

  • "workflow 1"
  • "WORKFLOW 1"

Jira will allow this to happen. However, generating a backup, and restoring this to a Cloud instance will fail on the validation stage.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create two Workflows, they may remain Inactive.
  2. Rename the first workflow as "workflow 1".
  3. Rename the second workflow also as "workflow 1".
    • Notice that Jira does not allow the second workflow to has the same name
  4. Proceed to rename the second workflow to "Workflow 1". This should go through.
  5. Now, generate a backup, and use this to import to a Cloud instance.

Expected Results

The import should go through, as Jira seems to allow the same workflow name but with different casing.

Actual Results

The import fails on the validation stage:

Notes

  1. This can also be resolved by not allowing the same workflow name but with different casing.
  2. This affects both, Cloud to Cloud, and Server to Cloud.
  3. There might also be occurrences where the duplicated workflow has the same name with the same casing, however, it is currently unknown on how it gets to this state.

Workaround

Delete or Rename one of the duplicate workflow on the Source instance, generate a new backup, and use the new backup to import.
item.summary: Duplicated Workflows in the backup file causes import to fail

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Backup & Restore - Import From JIRA Cloud

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70793] Mail Handler isn't creating new user
item.description:
Problem Statement

New users isn't created when email sent from non-existing user using the "create user" option checkbox within the mail handler configuration.

Steps to replicate

  1. Go to JIRA > JIRA Settings > System > Incoming Mail or "GG" Incoming Mail
  2. Click "Add incoming mail handler" button to create new mail handler.
  3. Click Next
  4. Select "Create a new issue or add acomment"
  5. Tick "Create Users" checkbox
  6. Click Add

Actual Result

User and issue isn't created

Expected Result

Create new JIRA user and issue using the user's email as a username, subject and content.

Workaround

To allow Jira to handle email messages sent from people without a Jira user account:

  1. Create an anonymous or dummy mail account on your mail server.
  2. Create an equivalent anonymous or dummy Jira user account, whose email address matches the mail account you just created.
  3. When configuring your mail handler options, set the Default Reporter to be the anonymous or dummy Jira user account.
item.summary: Mail Handler isn't creating new user

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

msg:	 Error while processing message: MailingListCompiler#sendItem

	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:137)

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70781] XSS in labels widget
item.description:
If a user can control the content returned by

/rest/dashboards/1.0/<dashboard_id>/gadget/10100/prefs

they can update the searchUrl field to execute a stored XSS.

Here are the steps to reproduce:

  1. Upload an attachment to a ticket with the following content: 
    {"groups":[{"key":"A-Z","labels":[{"label":"XSS","searchUrl":"javascript:alert(0);"}]}],"field":"Labels","project":"53W5"}
  2. Fetch the attachment ID from Jira (e.g. via /rest/api/2/issue/<issue_id>)
  3. Create a new label widget on a Dashboard and save it with the following content: 
    {"up_isConfigured":true,"up_projectid":"../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../../secure/attachment/<attachment_id>","up_fieldId":"foobar"}
    1. This can be done by issuing a PUT request to /rest/dashboards/1.0/<dashboard_id>/gadget/<gadget_id>/prefs
  4. Load the Dashboard and click on the XSS

I think there are two issues at play here:

  1. The user has control over the full path for fetching the gadget content (this is in https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRACLOUD/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/static/dashboarditem/labels/Labels.js#69)
    1. Remediation: Apply a regex that only allows valid project IDs (whitelist)
  2. The content of the response for the gadget content is trusted and inserted into the page verbatim: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRACLOUD/repos/jira/browse/jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/static/dashboarditem/labels/Labels.soy#29
    1. Remediation: Apply URI scheme whitelisting as recommended on https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECURITY/pages/158006558/URI+scheme+whitelisting. Better yet, if you know which URI schemes you can expect (only HTTP/HTTPS maybe?) you can restrict this list even further.

Note: Selected a random version since I couldn't determine mine.
item.summary: XSS in labels widget

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment:
CVSS v3 score: 5.4 => Medium severity

Exploitability Metrics

Attack Vector Network
Attack Complexity Low
Privileges Required Low
User Interaction Required

Scope Metric

Scope Changed

Impact Metrics

Confidentiality Low
Integrity Low
Availability None

See http://go.atlassian.com/cvss for more details.

https://asecurityteam.bitbucket.io/cvss_v3/#CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N

item.summary: Jira returns 400 error when searching for double-byte chars in quick search in IE

status.description: Atlassian needs to verify that this issue exists

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70747] On a iOS device,moving the issue type for a JSD project issue is not changing the status
item.description:
Summary

On an iOS device, when the issue type of a JSD project issue is changed, the issue type changes correctly but the status of the issue does not change. This puts the issue in a very weird state as the current status of the issue is not part of the workflow of the new issue type.

Environment

iOS
Jira Cloud

Steps to Reproduce

  • From the Jira app on iOS login and access the JSD project.
  • Change the issue type for an issue in the JSD project.
  • The issue type will change successfully but the issue status will not change.
  • The same can be confirmed by logging into the instance from the browser.
  • Basically, the issue status will not match the issue type workflow.

Expected Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device should also change the issue status(or at least an option to select the right status)

Actual Results

The change in the issue type of a JSD issue from an iOS device is not changing its status.

Workaround

None
item.summary: On a iOS device,moving the issue type for a JSD project issue is not changing the status

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70746] Notification scheme shows an error 500 when you add a JSD portal-only user as recipient
item.description:
Summary

When you're editing a notification scheme, JIRA allows you to select Service Desk portal-only users in the single user picker, and when you try to save, an error 500 is presented.

Environment

  • JIRA Cloud Service Desk

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the project settings > Notifications
  2. Click on Actions > Edit Notifications
  3. Click on Add (any event type)
  4. In the single-user field, start typing a name that matches a JSD portal-only user username
  5. Try to add the new notification with the portal-only user selected

Expected Results

An error should be presented stating that portal-only users cannot receive JIRA notifications. Or, they should not even be presented in this user-picker field.

Actual Results

An error 500 message is presented. This gives the idea that something is wrong in JIRA when in fact this could not be possible to be made by the customer.
item.summary: Notification scheme shows an error 500 when you add a JSD portal-only user as recipient

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70744] Incorrect URL when clicking on Cancel within notification scheme association
item.description:
Summary

When you're in the Notification Scheme association page, from within a project, and click on Cancel, the URL is incorrect and missing the project key. An error is presented stating that the project 'notifications' does not exist.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Go to the project settings > Notifications
  2. Click on Actions > Use a different scheme
  3. Click on Cancel

Expected Results

The system redirects you to the notification scheme page

Actual Results

The project key is missing from the URL that the Cancel link redirects, so an error is presented because the system redirects you to an invalid page.

Workaround

Manually go back to the notification scheme page by using the browser navigation.
item.summary: Incorrect URL when clicking on Cancel within notification scheme association

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70705] Issue creation fails with 500 error after uninstalling an add-on
item.description:
Summary

After uninstalling a third party add-on the issue creation in Jira may fail with 500 error.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Install BigPIcture
  2. Set the create screen configuration of a project to use the Risk XXX custom fields from BigPicture.
  3. Unsubscribe and then uninstall the BigPicture add-on
  4. Create an issue on the project.

Expected Results

The issue should be created.

Actual Results

The issue creation fails with a 500 error.

<p>Referer URL: <b>https://try-ramon-zephyr.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue.jspa</b></p><pre>java.lang.NullPointerException</pre><blockquote id="stacktrace" style="overflow-x: auto;"><pre>java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.validateCreateIssueFields(IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.validateCreateIssueFields(IssueCreationHelperBeanImpl.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.validateAndCreateIssueFromFields(DefaultIssueService.java:810)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.lambda$validateCreate$10(DefaultIssueService.java:758)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.metrics.Timer.time(Timer.java:171)

Workaround

After awhile the issue resolves itself and the issue can be created.
item.summary: Issue creation fails with 500 error after uninstalling an add-on

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70702] opsbar-sequence property does not work in new issue view
item.description:
Summary

opsbar-sequence property doesn't sequence transitions in corrent order in new issue view.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create multiple transitions from a status to other status'.
  2. Add opsbar-sequence property to each of the transtions and provide value based on how you want to order it.
  3. Checking in old issue view - the transitions are ordered as they are set in properties. On the contrary, the transitions do not follow the order as set in properties for the transitions.

Expected Results

Transitions should be in proper sequence as set in workflow properties in the new issue view.

Actual Results

Transtions do not appear in proper sequence. It does not follow the sequence as it is mentioned in opsbar-seqeunce property.

Workaround

No Workaround.
item.summary: opsbar-sequence property does not work in new issue view

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70697] New issue view for Jira Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails
item.description:
Summary

New issue view for Jira Software Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Turn off the new issue view in your personal settings
  2. Find a Jira Software issue with an existing image attachment
  3. Comment to that Jira issue with a content of 
     {quote} !filename.png|thumbnail! {quote}
  1. Confirm image appears in the comment as a quoted message
  2. return to your personal settings/profile and re-enable the new issue view
  3. refresh the Jira issue

Expected Results

Comment shows up as expected, with quoted text that contains an image/thumbnail

Actual Results

Comment does not show any content at all, including missing unquoted text.
When looking that the browser console you can see an error of:

RangeError: Invalid content for node blockquote
    at K.createChecked (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-fabric-renderer.9ee52142d83cf36e3350.7.js:1)
    at t.b (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at e.parse (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at Object.encode (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-fabric-renderer.9ee52142d83cf36e3350.7.js:1)
    at t.a (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at t.n.getAdfFromHtml (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at t.value (jira-frontend.prod.atl-paas.net/assets/async-renderer.a1dcfcce555194b306db.7.js:1)
    at Pn (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
    at qn (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
    at us (vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1)
Jn @ vendor.458cb3c0da8f0282cde5.7.js:1

Notes

Only appears to affect Jira Software projects, this does not appear to happen for Jira Core projects.

 

Workaround

Disabling the new issue view in your Personal settings can prevent this display problem for the time being.
item.summary: New issue view for Jira Cloud cannot display messages containing quoted thumbnails

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70696] Change option to Log Time in the New Issue View
item.description:
Summary

In the New Issue view, when one wants to adjust the Start date and time, the only time interval available is between 9am and 6pm

Environment

  • Jira Software Cloud
  • New Issue View

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Access any issue in the new issue view.
  2. Attempt to log time.
  3. Attempt to edit the Date started by clicking the calendar sign next to it
    Notice the time picker only shows the 9am - 6pm time interval
  1. Expected Results
    The time picker should show a whole day time interval

Actual Results

The time picker only shows 9am - 6pm, in 30 minutes increments

Workaround

There are currently 2 workarounds:

  1. Disable New Jira issue view under Profile → Labs section. This will bring the old issue view with another date/time picker
item.summary: Change option to Log Time in the New Issue View

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70692] When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text, it starts a new line
item.description:
Summary

When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text (including Hyperlinks), it starts a new line.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Enable the new issue view
  2. Open a ticket and add a bullet list with many sub-bullet points on the description.

Expected Results

It would look like this:

Actual Results

On the new issue view, after saving the description, it shows like this:

Workaround

Use the old view.
item.summary: When using the new issue view, adding a bullet list and sub-bullets then changing the style of the text, it starts a new line

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70690] Sprint burndown and Sprint health gadget not working properly in IE11
item.description:
Summary

The sprint burndown gadget gadget won't load in the dashboard. It won't be possible to edit it either (when clicking on the ellipses button, the edit option will not be displayed).
When click to view as wallboard, the gadget will be displayed as blank:

The sprint health gadget does work properly in the dashboard view, but when viewing in wallboard, it will behave the same way as the burndown gadget:

In both cases (including the dashboard view), the same error is triggered in the browser console:

Environment

Jira Cloud (IE11).

Steps to Reproduce

  1. In your dashboard, click on Add gadget -> select the sprint burndown gadget;
  2. Do the same as the previous step, but select the sprint health gadget;
  3. Notice in the dashboard view that the sprint burndown gadget will not load;
  4. Click on the ellipses button (dashboard) -> View as wallboard;
  5. Both the sprint health gadget and the burndown gadget will be displayed as blank squares;
  6. Other gadgets will work though.

Expected Results

Both gadgets would load their content in both the dashboard view and the wallboard view.

Actual Results

The Sprint burndown gadget won't work in neither the dashboard view, nor in the wallboard view.
The Sprint health gadget won't work in the wallboard view.

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Sprint burndown and Sprint health gadget not working properly in IE11

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70684] Invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project, the returned links are in api version 2
item.description:
Summary

When creating integrations for Jira and using 3LO for apps, invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project returns links that are still in version 2, and when they are accessed, that results in an HTTP 403 - Forbidden. Invoking invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/2/project results in a 403 as well

Steps to replicate

  1. Go through this until you get to: https://api.atlassian.com/oauth/token/accessible-resources
  2. Make a call to https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project and replace cloud-id
  3. Notice that links are in version 2:
  4. Try to invoke https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/2/project and returned 403
item.summary: Invoking https://api.atlassian.com/ex/jira/<cloudid>/rest/api/3/project, the returned links are in api version 2

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

comments.comment: /cc Cezary Zawadka

Hello Guys, 

I saw that you have passed this issue to medium severity.

We are blocked right now by this issue. 

Is there any workaround/suggestions on this?

Many thanks

Hi Karam EL HABOUTI,
Current workaround is to create those urls manually based on data/ids from the response.

The issue is on our radar however I cannot commit to any date.

Thank you for your prompt response.

The API v3 is not complete, requesting other endpoints like /issue returns an empty payload.

Thanks

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70678] "KB Hub", "Customer Channels", "Invite Team" buttons code bugged when administering a SD project
item.description:
Summary

In the updated navigation left sidebar, when a Jira admin is administering a Service Desk project, the "KB Hub", "Customer Channels" and "Invite Team" buttons are bugged, showing the code of the button instead of the button itself. Also, the button doesn't work.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Pre req 1: Be sure your instance is using the updated navigation left sidebar;
  2. Pre req 2: Be a Jira admin of that instance;
  3. Type the g key twice on your keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, your period key ( . ), then Projects;
  4. Find a Service Desk project, click the . . . icon on your right corner, then Project settings;
  5. Click Back to project.

Expected Results

  • All of the buttons of the left sidebar, used to administer the project, are available and functional

Actual Results

  • The "KB Hub", "Customer Channels" and "Invite Team" buttons are bugged, showing the code of the button instead of the button itself. Also, the button doesn't work.

Workaround(s)

  1. Open a support ticket at support.atlassian.com.
item.summary: "KB Hub", "Customer Channels", "Invite Team" buttons code bugged when administering a SD project

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70676] Scrolling while typing in the Assignee and in the Reporter field will hide their results
item.description:
Summary

If you scroll the screen while typing in the Assignee or in the reporter field (edit, create screen) their results will be lost, and you will need to restart typing it to retrieve them again.

See in this recording on how they differ from custom user picker fields: Assignee_Reporter - behaviour.mp4

Environment

Jira Cloud.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Click to edit an issue;
  2. Start typing in the Assignee or in the reporter field;
  3. While the results are being displayed, scroll the page.

Expected Results

The results will keep being displayed.

Actual Results

The results are lost and you need to delete what you've typed and start typing again to retrieve the results.

Workaround

No workaround at the moment
item.summary: Scrolling while typing in the Assignee and in the Reporter field will hide their results

status.description: This issue has been verified by Atlassian

  • Go to Find new add-ons page: https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/featured?source=side_nav_find_new_addons

Expected Results

The page is fully rendered and loaded.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70571] Comments from mobile that are restricted show padlocks in place of the comment in Russian in Old Issue View
item.description:
Summary

If you create comments from the mobile app, then restrict them, When using the new issue view in the Russian language, you will see the comments replaced by a number of restriction locks.

Environment

Cloud (Old Issue View)

Steps to Reproduce

  1. create a comment in an issue using the mobile platform
  2. Edit the issue so that you can restrict the comment to a specific group
  3. change to Russian language and view the issue
  4. Change to the old issue view if needed

Expected Results

The Comment is displayed as expected

Actual Results


As you can see, the comment is replaced by grey locks.

Workaround

This issue only appears if all of the following factors are met:

  • The comment was created from the mobile app
  • The comment is restricted
  • You are viewing the issue in the Old issue view
  • You are viewing the issue in Russian

If you can prevent or change any of those factors, you will not see this issue.
item.summary: Comments from mobile that are restricted show padlocks in place of the comment in Russian in Old Issue View

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70567] startofweek() jql function doesn't reflect system locale
item.description:
According to Advanced searching - functions reference:

For the startOfWeek() function the result depends upon your locale. For example, in Europe the first day
of the week is generally considered to be Monday, while in the USA it is considered to be Sunday.

But, seem not the case where only able to search start on Sunday issue.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

  1. Create issues in a project on Sunday and on Monday
  2. Change the time zone in the personal profile to Europe and GMT+1 or GMT+2.
  3. Change the Default users' time zone in the Jira Settings > Systems > General Configuration.
  4. In the Look and feel section, enable Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker in the Date/time formats.
  5. Look for issues created after startOfWeek().
  6. The issues that were created on Sunday and Monday will be displayed and not just after Monday.

Please investigate on what factor determines the Locale of the instance, as modifying the time zones in the Personal Profile and the General configuration does not bring about any changes in the search results.
item.summary: startofweek() jql function doesn't reflect system locale

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70559] Create issue through REST API failed with error
item.description:
Summary

Sending a REST API to create issue will fail when the value of description exceeds 10323 characters.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Prepare a Json file that contains value for description more than 10323 characters
  2. Run CURL command: 
    • curl --request POST --url 'https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue' --user email:token  --header 'Accept: application/json'  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data @descriptionValue.json

Actual Results

Error message will be shown.

{"errorMessages":["We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file."],"errors":{}}

Expected Results

Issue is created.

Notes

It is possible to insert characters up to 32767 to description field when users create the issue from the UI.
item.summary: Create issue through REST API failed with error

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70558] Unable to preview images that are uploaded using Jira mobile app
item.description:
Summary

When you click on an image attachment that is added to an issue using iOS application, the image won't be previewed and will be downloaded directly. While if the same image is uploaded through web interface it will be previewed when you click on it.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Access an issue using JIRA iOS application
  2. Upload an image to the issue.
  3. Access the issue using a browser (in PC) and click on the uploaded attachment

Expected Results

The image attachment is being previewed

Actual Results

The image will be downloaded directly

Notes

  • Tested for images with JPG and PNG extensions.
  • The image attachments could be previewed when accessing through iOS app or mobile browser.
item.summary: Unable to preview images that are uploaded using Jira mobile app

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70556] Searching for STATUS CHANGED BY is suggesting status names instead of usernames
item.description:

When searching for "STATUS CHANGED BY", instead of suggesting usernames, it's suggeting status names.

Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce:

  1. Go to the advanced search page.
  2. type "status changed by" and then a space.

Expected: suggestions from a list of users that changes as you type.

Actual: suggestions show the Status field values.

Workaround

item.title: [JRACLOUD-70552] Create linked issue does not respect custom field config context default values
item.description:
Summary

Create linked issue does not respect custom field config scheme context

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Create a select list custom field
  2. Create a new context so there are 2 and assign each context to a project and provide different values/option
  3. Set default value for each context
  4. Mark field as required in field config for both projects
  5. Note when creating an issue in each project now they have different values and a set default value according to the context
  6. Create a linked issue
  7. Note the default values are not respected, it chooses the first valuy as opposed to the default or none

Expected Results

The default option defined in the field context should be chosen

Actual Results

The first option is selected regardless of the chosen default

Notes

Also effects radio buttons, sometimes an incorrect value is chosen, other times no value is chosen

Workaround

No known workaround
item.summary: Create linked issue does not respect custom field config context default values

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.component: Project Administration - Issue type, fields and Other

comments.comment:
Thanks for having opening an issue for this bug.

I hope it will be soon corrected, because it can lead to error when filling form during the creation of the linked issue. As a wrong preselected option is proposed, if the agent is not careful the field in the created linked issue will have not the intended value (it will have the first choice instead the default one).

And in our case we use this for important billing information to transfert issue information from service desk issue to the Jira software issue, so even if the bug himself is low priority, it can lead business problem.

Best regards.
